text.section: This section applies to the State Police Retirement System.

Except as provided in § 24-401.1(k) of this article, the Board of Trustees shall grant a special disability retirement allowance to a member if:
the member is totally and permanently incapacitated for duty arising out of or in the course of the actual performance of duty without willful negligence by the member; and
the medical board certifies that:
the member is totally incapacitated, either mentally or physically, for the further performance of duty;
the incapacity is likely to be permanent; and
the member should be retired.

Except as provided in subsection (d) of this section, a special disability retirement allowance equals the lesser of:
the member's average final compensation; or
the sum of:
an annuity that is the actuarial equivalent of the member's accumulated contributions at retirement; and
a pension equal to two-thirds of the member's average final compensation.

section.section: This subsection applies to a member who is at least normal retirement age.

A special disability retirement allowance equals the greater of:
a normal service retirement allowance; or
a special disability retirement allowance computed in accordance with subsection (c) of this section.
